intro: Miconia kranzlinii, commonly known as the Kranzlin's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
